title: The King's own borderers :
author: Grant, James
snippet: And now, my lord, when you are at leisure, I wish to shew you a new farmsteading  I have erected at the Cairns of Blackhinney,  and also how bravely the young trees are thriving in the oakwood shaw."

title: The King's own borderers :
author: Grant, James
snippet: the more modern mansion built in the time of James VI., by Hugh, third Lord Rohallion, who slew the gipsy king in single combat at the Cairns of Blackhinney.
